contents:
1. A triangular shaped sign is a:  A. yield sign B. warning sign C. railroad sign D. stop sign   Answer : yield sign
 2. A holder of a student permit must have the following with them while driving:  A. Adult supervising driver in the front Seat B. Their student permit C. Registration and insurance ID card D. All of the above  3. Effective July 1, 2004, motorists in New Jersey may not use a hand-held wireless telephone while driving except for the following instances:  A. Fire B. Traffic accidents C. Medical emergency D. All of the above  4. When approaching or nearing an uncontrolled intersection you should:  A. speed up to clear intersection quickly B. slow down and look straight ahead C. reduce speed and be ready to stop D. Always come to a full stop  5. When the pavement is marked with 2 centerlines, 1 solid and 1 broken:  A. passing is permitted only on the side with the broken line B. passing is permitted on either side C. passing is permitted on both sides, but only when the road is clear D. passing is not permitted on either side  6. Road surfaces are most slippery:  A. during very hot, humid weather B. during very cold, dry weather C. After a very heavy rainfall D. during the first few minutes of a rainfall  7. New Jersey law allows up to 3 points to be subtracted from your driving record if you have no moving traffic violation:  A. for 2 years from the date of the last violation B. for 6 months from the date of the last violation C. for 1 year from the date of the last violation D. for 18 months from the date of the last violation  8. If the driver of a large truck or bus cannot see you in his rearview mirrors, you are:  A. in the truck’s no-zone or blind spot B. Driving to slowly C. Uninteresting to him D. driving a compact car  9. A single, solid white line across a road at an intersection means  A. no parking zone B. bus stop C. no passing D. stop behind the line for a traffic sign or light  10. The best way to take a curve is:  A. speed up while in the curve B. lean in the direction of the curve C. slow down before entering the curve D. slow down after entering the curve  11. When nearing a steady yellow or amber traffic signal, you should  A. stop immediately, do not continue through the intersection B. slow down and continue with caution through the intersection C. stop before entering the intersection, if you can safely do so D. speed up and continue through the intersection before the light changes to red  12. A twelve-ounce can of beer has as much alcohol in it as:  A. A bottle of rum B. 2 martinis C. 1 1⁄2 ounces of 86 proof whiskey D. A pint of brandy  13. When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing lights you must:  A. stop at the crossing B. slow down and look both ways C. slow down, blow your horn and proceed with caution D. All of the above  14. To safely share the road with large trucks and buses, you must know:  A. The horsepower rating of your vehicle. B. The history of the trucking industry. C. Limitations of these vehicles regarding visibility, stopping distances required and maneuverability. D. The impact trucks and large vehicles have on the environment.  15. Getting a drivers license illegally may result in:  A. imprisonment of 6 months B. A fine of $200 to $500 and/or imprisonment of 30-90 days C. A court trial D. A fine of $25 to $l00  16. In adverse weather conditions, a truck takes longer to stop. This can be as much as:  A. 70% more B. 25% more C. 50% more D. 100% more  17. If under 21, New Jersey law states that you may be under the influence if your blood alcohol level content is  A. More than .10% but less than .15% B. More than .05% but less than .10% C. More than .01% but less than .05% D. All of the above  18. A supervising driver for the holder of a validated GDL Permit must meet which of the following requirements:  A. Must be 21 years or older B. Must be a New Jersey licensed driver C. Must be licensed for a minimum of 3 years D. A, B, and C  19. The holder of a validated GDL permit (21 years of age or older) is restricted to what driving hours?  A. 6:01AM to midnight B. No restrictions apply C. 5:01AM to midnight D. 5:01AM to 11:00PM  20. The holder of a validated GDL Special Learner’s permit must not drive between the hours of:  A. 11:01PM and 6:00AM B. 11:01PM and 5:00AM C. No restrictions apply D. 12:01AM and 5:00AM  21. New Jersey law requires that a child must be seated in a child restraint device while riding in a car if:  A. The child is under 5 years of age and riding in the front seat B. The child is under 18 months of age and is riding in the front seat C. The child is under 18 months of age and is riding in the back seat D. All of the above  22. You may not park within how many feet of a fire hydrant?  A. 50 feet B. 25 feet C. 20 feet D. 10 feet  23. How many passengers may accompany the holder of a validated GDL Special Learners Permit in the vehicle?  A. 0 B. Any passengers from their shared residence plus 1 additional person, C. 2 D. None of the above.  24. In city driving, a good habit is to:  A. use the 2 second rule B. reduce speed and use horn C. look 12 seconds ahead D. practice good judgment  25. The “2 second rule” can be used at any speed to help you:  A. drive within the speed limit B. bring your car out of a skid C. Time traffic lights at intersections D. keep a safe following distance  26. If you drink and have reached a BAC of slightly above .05%, the risk of your causing a motor vehicle accident is:  no different Triple double none of the above  27. If you approach an intersection and a large truck is stopped for the traffic light, you should:  Blow your horn so the driver will know you are there. Go around the truck on the right because he will startup slower. Stop with enough distance so you will not be in a blind spot and you can see the driver in hismirror. Stop as close to the rear of the truck as possible so no one can get in front of you.  28. When it is legal to turn right on red, before turning, you must:  slow down and check traffic make a full stop and check traffic blow your horn check traffic to right  29. If you drink beyond a SAC of .05%, the risk of your causing a motor vehicle accident doubles and at. 10% the risk increases to:  4 times as great 10 times as great 6 times as great 3 times as great  30. If a person has been drinking, which of the following can sober them up?  fresh air drinking strong black coffee Time A cold shower  31. The best way to “talk” to other drivers on the road is to:  be courteous and wave use your horn and lights roll down your window and yell All of the above  32. If you sell your car (and do not buy another) what should you do with the license plates?  give them to a friend to use keep them as a souvenir Turn them into a Motor Vehicle inspection facility Throw them away  33. In city driving you should:  drive more slowly watch for pedestrians look at least 12 seconds ahead All of the above  34. The holder of a Provisional Driver License is not permitted use of which of the following while driving:  Hand held electronic devices Hand held video game Cell phones All of the above  35. The holder of a Provisional License, who is under the age of 21, may drive unsupervised when the following requirement is met:  6 months of supervised driving Pass a road test Pass a road test after 6 months of supervised driving, excluding any suspensions or postponements Pass a road test after 6 months of supervised driving  36. You should always yield to:  emergency vehicles pedestrians Other vehicles already in the intersection All of the above  37. In New Jersey, studded snow tires can be legally used between:  September 30th and May 30th October 15th and March 15th April 1st and December 15th November 15th and April 1st  38. When parking uphill on a Street with a curb on your right, your car wheels should be:  Turned away from the curb Turned straight ahead Turned to the right Turned toward the curb  39. Altering a driver’s license, or showing an altered driver’s license, may result in  A fine of up to $1000 up to 6 months imprisonment loss of your driving privilege All of the above  40. The driving hours of a GDL Examination Permit or Provisional License (under 21 years of age) are restricted to:  5:01AM to 11:00PM 5:01 AM to midnight 6:01 AM to midnight No restrictions apply  41. If a person gets drunk in your home and has a motor vehicle accident after leaving your home,you could:  be charged with a crime not be held responsible become involved in a lawsuit none of the above  42. A provisional driver is provisional for how long?  4 years l year 6 months 3 months  43. When parking downhill on a street with a curb on your right, your car wheels should be:  Turned away from the curb Turned straight ahead Turned toward the curb Turned to the left  44. You cannot park:  in front of a fire hydrant in a bus stop in front of a driveway All of the above  45. Double solid lines in the center of a 2-way road means:  Traffic should not cross from either side “pass with care” road A 1-way Street A divided highway  46. A person may operate a Moped with:  A valid basic license A valid motorcycle license A valid moped license Any of the above  47. Emotions can have a great effect on your driving; if you are angry or excited you should:  give yourself time to cool off blow your horn to warn other drivers drive with your radio on none of the above  48. The best way to reduce your chances of having an alcohol related accident is to:  not drive at all after drinking know your own limits reduce your drinking have a meal before drinking  49. When making a left turn from a two-way road onto a 4 lane highway, the proper way to turn is:  Approach the turn as close to the centerline of the road as possible make the turn before reaching the center of the intersection Turn into the left lane of the road going in your direction All of the above  50. If you go into a skid you should:  Take your foot off the gas pedal straighten your wheels Apply your brakes make a fast turn

contents: Strikes the upper surface of the impenetrable foliage of my trees, and but a few stray gleams steal into the inner sanctuary, I throw myself down among the tall grass by the trickling stream and, as I lie close to the earth, a thousand unknown plants are noticed by me.When I hear the buzz of the little world among the stalks, and grow familiar with the countless indescribable forms of the insects and flies, then I feel the presence of the Almighty, who formed us in his own image, and the breath of that universal love which bears and sustains.
